diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Heroin-Induced Rhabdomyolysis with Reflex Sympathetic Dystrophy
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The diagnosis was based on the patient's symptoms of constant burning pain and vasomotor instability in both feet following nontraumatic rhabdomyolysis secondary to smoking heroin. Three-phase bone scintigraphy indicated increased radioactivity consistent with reflex sympathetic dystrophy, and pain relief was achieved after calcitonin therapy.
